column4: what maco is saying is that 8.04 is currently still supported, with updates.  But once a version has become EOL you SHOULD NOT use it.
why bother with 8.04?  why not use a newer version?  even with older hardware newer versions of ubuntu should work fine, or check out xubuntu for a slightly "lighter" system.
good point. I downloaded Lubuntu the other day to try on this old system and it is great so far. Heck, I guess I could even put Lucid server minimal on it and manually install LXDE if I wanted.
